channel.title: BBC Sport
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/terms-of-use/#15metadataandrssfeeds for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Is there any way back for Salah and Liverpool?
item.description: After Mohamed Salah's explosive interview about his Liverpool future, BBC Sport takes a closer look at if there is a way back for him.

item.title: Nancy suffers nightmare debut as his Celtic challenge laid bare
item.description: BBC Scotland's Martin Dowden assesses Wilfried Nancy's first game in charge of Celtic as Hearts win at Parkhead.

item.title: 'Everyone follows fashion' - is Premier League better now than 20 years ago?
item.description: In his BBC Sport column, ex-Premier League boss Tony Pulis looks at what has changed in the Premier League in the past couple of decades and whether it is for the better, from a manager's perspective.

item.title: Chelsea unbeatable no more - is WSL now Man City's to lose?
item.description: After 585 days, and 34 Women's Super League games, Chelsea's unbeaten domestic league run is at an end - so is it now Manchester City's title to lose?

item.title: World Cup to have 13 different kick-off times
item.description: The 2026 World Cup will feature 13 different kick-off times, with almost half the group stage matches taking place after 00:00 BST.

item.title: Footballer arrested on suspicion of assault
item.description: An international footballer, who cannot be named for legal reasons, was arrested in central London on suspicion of assault and affray.

item.title: Guehi scores late header to secure Crystal Palace win over Fulham
item.description: Crystal Palace captain Marc Guehi scores a late header for a 2-1 win against Fulham which moves them into the top four in the Premier League.

item.title: Brighton equalise in stoppage time against West Ham
item.description: Georginio Rutter scores a controversial equaliser for Brighton as they draw 1-1 to deny West Ham United the chance to escape the relegation zone.

item.title: Everton end Chelsea's record breaking undefeated run
item.description: Everton have put an end to Chelsea's record breaking 34 match undefeated run with Honoka Hayashi's goal making the difference.

item.title: Man City remain top of the table after Shaw double
item.description: Khadija Shaw scores twice and Kerolin Nicoli scores on her return from injury for Manchester City to beat Leicester City 3-0 and remain at the top of the table.

item.title: Man Utd return to WSL top three with win over West Ham United
item.description: Manchester United return to a top three position in the WSL table with a 2-1 win over West Ham United.

item.title: 'It was handball, wasn't it?' - why Rutter goal against West Ham stood
item.description: Georginio Rutter's late equaliser in Brighton's 1-1 draw with West Ham on Sunday was allowed to stand despite handball claims. BBC Sport looks at the rules to explain why.

item.title: Spurs investigate Bissouma nitrous oxide claim
item.description: Tottenham say they are looking into allegations that midfielder Yves Bissouma was filmed inhaling nitrous oxide.

item.title: 'Hearts' fight is with themselves but what do they do now?'
item.description: Amy Canavan assesses the next steps for Hearts after their second win over Celtic this season.

item.title: 'One of them has to go' - Liverpool fans react to Salah interview
item.description: BBC Sport visits Anfield to find out how Liverpool fans are feeling following Mohamed Salah's explosive interview after being left out the side for a third straight game.

item.title: Skinner demands Man Utd action in transfer window
item.description: Manchester United boss Marc Skinner says the club needs to be aggressive in the January transfer window.

item.title: 'A clear challenge to Slot's authority in Salah's show of rebellion'
item.description: Mohamed Salah's astonishing public attack on Liverpool and Arne Slot piles pressure on the troubled head coach, says chief football writer Phil McNulty.

item.title: Fiorentina take security measures after threats
item.description: Fiorentina say they have taken security measures to protect players, staff and their families after they receive "unacceptable and shameful" threats.

item.title: Rangers take 'good step forward' as Miovski shines
item.description: Head coach Danny Rohl believes Rangers are moving in the right direction as Bojan Miovski scores twice in a 3-0 win at Kilmarnock.

item.title: Former Liverpool co-owner Hicks dies aged 79
item.description: American Tom Hicks, who owned Liverpool alongside George Gillett from 2007 to 2010, dies at his home in Dallas.

item.title: Evening World Cup kick-offs for England, but Scotland face 2am opener
item.description: England are handed World Cup kick-off times which suit UK audiences - but Scotland fans face later finishes during next summer's tournament.

item.title: 'I never saw Messi do this' - Guardiola no fan of Cherki rabona assist
item.description: Rayan Cherki's sublime assist in Manchester City's win over Sunderland on Saturday drew gasps from the home crowd and may be a moment of inspiration to turn the tide in the title race.

item.title: 'One of the magic nights at Elland Road' - Leeds' week of hope
item.description: Leeds United's daunting week in the Premier League was expected to condemn them to the Championship, but it turned into their "week of hope".

item.title: Are Aston Villa in title hunt - and should Arsenal start to worry?
item.description: Unai Emery continues to deny Aston Villa are in the Premier League title race but Arsenal now look vulnerable.

item.title: Weston-super-Mare make history and joy for two Robins - FA Cup round-up
item.description: BBC Sport reflects on the key talking points from the FA Cup second round results as non-league Weston-super-Mare go through.

item.title: 'A wonderful miracle' - how Messi & Beckham made Miami shine
item.description: In the world of team sport, no-one adores the achievements of its most accomplished individuals more than America's sports-mad fans, writes Guillem Balague.

item.title: Salah 'making it all about him' - Murphy
item.description: Former Liverpool midfielder Danny Murphy says Mohamed Salah is "making it all about him" after the winger criticised the club and manager Arne Slot.

item.title: 'He has to score, or we replace him' - Barry finally ends goal drought
item.description: The smile said it all after Thierno Barry got his first Everton goal in his 17th game for the club, and the challenge now is for him to keep scoring.

item.title: 'Spurs boss Frank eases pressure but tide has not turned yet'
item.description: Spurs head coach Thomas Frank sees the pressure eased with victory over Brentford - but the tide has not turned yet, says chief football writer Phil McNulty.

item.title: 'I'm free' - Â£1m Smith provides Arsenal spark
item.description: Olivia Smith steals the show with a goalscoring display against former side Liverpool to help Arsenal climb back into the Women's Super League top three.

item.title: On the rise & without fear - Motherwell a force under Askou
item.description: BBC Scotland explores Motherwell's revolution under Jens Berthel Askou

item.title: Slough's player-manager was everywhere
item.description: Slough Town's player-manager Scott Davies tried everything he could get his side into the next round, but fell to 3-1 loss against Macclesfield in the second round of the FA Cup.

item.title: Blackpool ease past Carlisle with three first-half goals
item.description: Blackpool progress to the third round of the FA Cup after beating Carlisle United 4-1.

item.title: Tottenham come from behind to beat Villa in stoppage time
item.description: Kirsty Hanson opens scoring in the 85th minute for Villa but Bethany England and Olivia Holdt respond quickly for Tottenham to win 2-1.

item.title: Brighton hold on to win with early opening goal against London City Lionesses
item.description: Kiko Seike's sixth minute goal for Brighton is enough to beat London City Lionesses 1-0.

item.title: Edmonson scores 'sensational' strike for Macclesfield
item.description: JJames Edmonson scores a "sensational" goal for Macclesfield against Slough Town to help his side reach the third round of the FA Cup for the first time since the club reformed.

item.title: Murphy critical of Salah comments
item.description: Match of the Day pundit Danny Murphy is critical of Mohamed Salah's comments on his situation at the club, following Liverpool's 3-3 draw at Leeds.

item.title: Non-league Boreham Wood dominate League Two Newport to reach third round
item.description: National League side Boreham Wood reach the third round of the FA Cup for the first time in three years with a convincing 3-0 win over League Two side Newport County.

item.title: 'We deserved to be lucky' - Glasner on Palace win
item.description: Crystal Palace boss Oliver Glasner praises side after their 2-1 win over Fulham, calling the opposition's ruled out goal as "lucky".

item.title: 'I don't understand' - Nuno says Brighton goal should not have stood
item.description: West Ham boss Nuno Espirito Santo says he Brighton's late equaliser should have been ruled out for handball and a high boot.

item.title: Slot in disbelief after Liverpool twice squander lead against Leeds
item.description: Liverpool boss Arne Slot says they "did not deserve that result" as they twice surrendered the lead during a 3-3 draw against Leeds.

item.title: Haaland v Mbappe, dream ties and YMCA - the best of the World Cup draw
item.description: YMCA, Donald Trump and Kylian Mbappe v Erling Haaland - BBC Sport runs through the best bits from the World Cup draw.

item.title: 'Some say I've found my level' - how Hughes regained spark at Carlisle
item.description: As Carlisle United prepare for Sunday's FA Cup tie at Blackpool, Mark Hughes opens up on managing in non-league after taking charge of 466 Premier League games.

item.title: I want to come back to Premier League and win it this time - Pochettino
item.description: Former Spurs boss Mauricio Pochettino sits down with Kelly Somers to talk about growing up on a farm, barbecues and his future.

item.title: Sutton's predictions v DJ and producer Paige Tomlinson
item.description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on DJ Paige Tomlinson - and AI - with his predictions for this weekend's Premier League fixtures.

item.title: England's AI World Cup masterplan - from perfecting penalties to powering players
item.description: BBC Sport hears from inside the England setup about how artificial intelligence is powering plans for next summer's World Cup.

item.title: Transfers - September to December 2025
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: Who is Arsenal teenager Salmon?
item.description: Arsenal add 16-year-old Marli Salmon to their squad for Saturday's Premier League game against Aston Villa at Villa Park, but who is he?

item.title: Which team won the fewest points in a Premier League season?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team look at which clubs amassed the lowest points tally in a single season.

item.title: What is the dubious goals committee?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains what the dubious goals committee is and how the identities of goal scorers are decided

item.title: Why is Son Heung-min returning to Tottenham?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explain why former captain Son Heung-min is returning to Tottenham.

item.title: When are Premier League players heading to Afcon?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains when players will meet up with their countries at the 2025 Africa Cup of Nations.

item.title: Aberdeen finding their groove after shaky start
item.description: Aberdeen are quietly climbing the table after a solid 3-1 win away to Dundee.

item.title: Barca defender Araujo taking mental health break
item.description: Barcelona defender Ronald Araujo has been granted a leave of absence to "take care of himself emotionally", the club confirms.

item.title: How Viking ended 34-year Norwegian title drought
item.description: Viking FK wrap up their first Norwegian league title in 34 years, sparking big celebrations in the city of Stavanger. BBC Sport takes a look at their achievement.

item.title: Ajax criticise 'outrageous' fireworks after match abandoned
item.description: Ajax criticise the "utterly outrageous" firework display which resulted in their Dutch league match against Groningen being abandoned.

item.title: What's going on with fan disorder at European games?
item.description: Was the disorder of Young Boys fans at Aston Villa an isolated incident, or does it indicate something more prevalent?

item.title: The great number nine decline - where have England's strikers gone?
item.description: BBC Sport takes an in-depth look at why England lack centre-forward options behind Harry Kane - a far cry from when the likes of Les Ferdinand only won 17 caps.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: How does Daniel Levy run Tottenham - and would he ever leave?
item.description: With Tottenham struggling on the pitch and chairman Daniel Levy facing criticism from fans, BBC Sport looks at how the club is run and what the future might hold.

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.
